title: Linguistic Roots of Bengali
content:
Bengali belongs to the Indo-Aryan group of languages.
It is a distant relative of German, French, Spanish, and Russian.
image_desc: [Image Description in English only: A family tree showing the linguistic connections of Bengali.]
narration: Bengali is part of the Indo-Aryan group of languages, making it a distant relative of many European languages like German, French, Spanish, and Russian.

title: Influences on Bengali
content:
Bengali evolved from Sanskrit and Magadhi Prakrit.
It was also influenced by Dravidian, Austro-Asiatic, and Tibeto-Burman languages.
image_desc: [Image Description in English only: A picture of ancient Sanskrit and Prakrit texts.]
narration: Bengali evolved from Sanskrit and Magadhi Prakrit, but it also borrowed words and structures from other language families in South Asia, like Dravidian, Austro-Asiatic, and Tibeto-Burman.

title: Bengali Dialects
content:
**Column 1**:
Radha (West Bengal)
Pundra (Northern West Bengal and Bangladesh)
Kamrupa (Northeastern Bangladesh)
Bangla (Rest of Bangladesh)
**Column 2**:
Sylhet
Chittagong
image_desc: [Image Description in English only: A map of Bangladesh and West Bengal showing the different dialect regions.]
narration: Bengali has several dialects, with the main ones being Radha, Pundra, Kamrupa, and Bangla. Sylhet and Chittagong also have unique dialects.
